- Known as "Unification of Death"
- Secret nationalist military society formed in 1911 by [[Serbia]] officers with the aim of **unifying South Slavs** including Serbs, Bosnians, Slovenes and Croats into a Greater Serbia (now known as [[Yugoslavia]])
- Headed by [[Dragutin Dimitrijevic]]
	- Swore their members in with rituals involving blood and blindfolds
- By late 1911, the group held strong influence in the army, recruited members, terrorized government officials, and published nationalist propaganda newspapers with negative remarks against [[Nikola Pasic]] moderate stance on a "Greater Serbia"
	- After victories in the Balkan Wars in [[1914]], the group had clashes with the government about who will rule the newly annexed regions
	- Tensions nearly boiled over into a coup to remove Pasic from power but the [[Russia]] Prime Minister, backed by [[France]], wouldn't allow it 
		- The current government had prevailed but only through foreign policy and without defeating their enemy - this was when the Black Hand received their weapons
	- The question arises of whether Apis armed the Black Hand destabilize [[Austria-Hungary]] or to overthrow how own government - **international terrorism or domestic politics?**
		- This asks another question: Was the assassination on [[Franz Ferdinand]] only supposed to be an attempt, which would anger the Austrians to gain international support to remove Pasic from power
		- Following the costly Balkan Wars, Serbia could hardly handle another military conflict, let alone with a power 10 times its size - However, a successful assassination attempt with roots to Serbia would more likely provoke rather than prevent it
	- This suggests Apis did not expect nor want the assassination to succeed, he wanted to merely frighted them, hence why he recalled the weapons - only it was too late - rotten luck
- The first assassin failed to act and the second's bomb missed its mark, leading all but [[Gavrilo Princip]] to flee the scene
	- Standing on a corner on the originally scheduled path, with no heightened security, the driver turned Ferdinand right into Princip's path, where he shot and killed the Archduke and his wife
- There were many potential **motives** for the rise of the Black Hand and an (un)successful assassination attempt
	- Serbian independence/rise of an empire
	- Rid their homeland of foreign rule
	- Overthrow government
- The reality is that it was a poorly orchestrated interaction terrorist act by Bosnian assassin that succeeded regardless of Black Hand intentions
- 7 members were involved in the assassination of Franz Ferdinand (top 3 were transported to [[Sarajevo]] to carry out the mission)
	- [[Trifko Grabež]]
	- [[Gavrilo Princip]]
	- [[Nedeljko Čabrinović]]
		- Threw bomb which bounced off Ferdinand's car and exploded beneath another vehicle
	- [[Muhamed Mehmedbašić]]
	- [[Vaso Čubrilović]]
	- [[Cvjetko Popović]]

![Eight of the Deadliest Assassin Groups in History](https://cdn.historycollection.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/blackhandedit-2-copy.jpg)

- [[Dragutin Dimitrijevic]] and two others executed after being found guilty for treason and more than 200 others imprisoned in [[1917]]

![WWI: The Death of Peace- II. The Black Hand](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
A bomb, knife, and vial of poison are their symbol
